message_1: A transposition cipher is created by shifting the letters of a message by a certain number of positions. If a message "HELLO WORLD" is encrypted using a transposition cipher where every second letter is shifted one position to the right, what would be the encrypted message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO WORLD" using a transposition cipher where every second letter is shifted one position to the right, we will follow these steps:

1. Identify every second letter: E, L, O, O, L
2. Shift each of these letters one position to the right in the alphabet: F, M, P, P, M
3. Replace the original letters with the shifted letters: HFLMP WPPMD

So, the encrypted message is "HFLMP WPPMD".
